title: Anode Baking Process Improvement at ALRO
abstract: Along with the partial refractory refurbishment of their three anode baking furnaces, ALRO wanted to reduce their consumption of natural gas and achieve complete combustion of the volatile compounds. Fives Solios proposed its process control expertise and up-to-date technology to upgrade the existing Firing Control System. Advanced software along with CO analysers and high velocity gas injectors were implemented for better combustion control. Port Sealing Ramp and low pressure drop dampers were provided to improve the operating conditions of the furnaces. Additionally, baking profile adjustments, based on CO continuous measurement and balance between the draft and the thermal demand in the heating zones, were jointly conducted by ALRO and Fives Solios resulting in a sustainable reduction of the energy consumption and improved combustion of the volatile compounds while maintaining a consistent anode quality.

motivations: ALRO aimed to reduce their consumption of natural gas in the anode baking process.
There was a need to achieve complete combustion of volatile compounds during the anode baking process.
objectives: Improve the anode baking process by upgrading the existing Firing Control System.
Achieve better combustion control and reduce energy consumption while maintaining consistent anode quality.
methods: Implement advanced software, CO analysers, and high velocity gas injectors for enhanced combustion control.
Utilize Port Sealing Ramp and low pressure drop dampers to improve furnace operating conditions.
Conduct baking profile adjustments based on continuous CO measurement and balance between draft and thermal demand.
results: Sustainably reduce energy consumption in the anode baking process.
Improve combustion of volatile compounds while maintaining consistent anode quality.
